subject: linear_algebra
title: QR Decomposition: Orthogonal × Upper Triangular
statementHtml: Given a matrix A ∈ ℝ^(m×n), find an orthogonal matrix Q ∈ ℝ^(m×m) and an upper triangular matrix R ∈ ℝ^(n×n) such that A = QR.
hints: Hint: Start with the Gram-Schmidt process
solutionHtml: To solve this problem, we'll use the Gram-Schmidt process to orthogonalize the columns of A. We'll then construct Q and R.
steps: [ {"stepNumber": 1, "description": "Find the first orthogonal vector", "mathHtml": "\[q_1 = \frac{\mathbf{a}_1}{\|\mathbf{a}_1\|} = \frac{\begin{bmatrix}1 \\ 3\end{bmatrix}}{\sqrt{10}}\]", "explanation": "We normalize the first column of A."}, {"stepNumber": 2, "description": "Find the second orthogonal vector", "mathHtml": "\[q_2 = \frac{\mathbf{a}_2 - \text{proj}_{q_1}(\mathbf{a}_2)}{\|\mathbf{a}_2 - \text{proj}_{q_1}(\mathbf{a}_2)\|}\]", "explanation": "We subtract the projection of the second column onto the first orthogonal vector."}, {"stepNumber": 3, "description": "Construct Q and R", "mathHtml": "\[Q = \begin{bmatrix}q_1 & q_2\end{bmatrix}, R = \begin{bmatrix}5 & 3 \\ 0 & 1\end{bmatrix}\]", "explanation": "We combine the orthogonal vectors to form Q, and the remaining columns of A form R."}, {"stepNumber": 4, "description": "Verify QR decomposition", "mathHtml": "\[A = QR = \begin{bmatrix}q_1 & q_2\end{bmatrix}\begin{bmatrix}5 & 3 \\ 0 & 1\end{bmatrix} = \begin{bmatrix}1 & 2 \\ 3 & 4\end{bmatrix}\]", "explanation": "We verify that A is equal to the product of Q and R."}, ],
intuition: QR decomposition is a powerful tool for orthogonalizing vectors and upper-triangularizing matrices. It has numerous applications in machine learning, such as principal component analysis (PCA) and singular value decomposition (SVD).

title: QR Decomposition: Orthogonal × Upper Triangular
contentHtml: In this worked example, we'll demonstrate how to solve a problem step-by-step using QR decomposition.

formula.latex: \[Q R = \begin{bmatrix} q_{11} & q_{12} \\ q_{21} & q_{22} \end{bmatrix} \begin{bmatrix} r_{11} & r_{12} \\ 0 & r_{22} \end{bmatrix}\]
formula.name: QR Decomposition

problem.statementHtml: Given a matrix A, find the orthogonal matrix Q and upper triangular matrix R such that A = QR.
problem.solutionHtml:
Solution:

  • Step 1: Normalize the first column of A to get q_{11}. Math: \(q_{11} = \frac{a_{11}}{|a_{11}|}\). Why: This ensures that Q is orthogonal.
  • Step 2: Subtract the projection of the second column onto the first column from the second column. Math: \(r_{12} = a_{12} - q_{11}^T a_{22}\). Why: This eliminates the inner product between the columns, making R upper triangular.
  • Step 3: Repeat Steps 1 and 2 for each subsequent column until all columns are processed.

workedExample.problemHtml: Given A = \[\begin{bmatrix} 1 & 2 & 3 \\ 4 & 5 & 6 \end{bmatrix}\], find Q and R such that A = QR.

intuition: QR decomposition is a powerful tool for solving systems of linear equations and computing eigenvalues.
